day_title: Solemnity of Mary, the Holy Mother of God (Holy Day of Obligation)
day_description: This Solemnity celebrates the Blessed Virgin Mary's unique role as the Mother of God, recognizing her as the Theotokos. It is also observed as the World Day of Peace.

day_title: Memorial of Saints Basil the Great and Gregory Nazianzen, Bishops and Doctors of the Church
day_description: This memorial honors two influential Cappadocian Fathers of the Church, St. Basil the Great and St. Gregory Nazianzen. They were instrumental in developing early Christian theology and defending the Nicene Creed.

day_title: Optional Memorial of The Most Holy Name of Jesus
day_description: This optional memorial encourages devotion to the Holy Name of Jesus, a practice that emphasizes the power and significance of the name of Christ.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Elizabeth Ann Seton, Religious (USA)
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Elizabeth Ann Seton, the first American-born saint. She was a convert to Catholicism and founded the Sisters of Charity of St. Joseph.

day_title: Solemnity of The Epiphany of the Lord (transferred to Sunday in the USA)
day_description: The Solemnity of the Epiphany celebrates the manifestation of Jesus as the Son of God to the Gentiles, traditionally marked by the adoration of the Magi.

day_title: Monday after Epiphany
day_description: This day falls within the Christmas season, following the Solemnity of Epiphany, and continues to reflect on the manifestation of Christ to the world.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Raymond of Penyafort, Priest
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Raymond of Penyafort, a Dominican friar and canon lawyer known for his contributions to Church law and his work with converts.

day_title: Wednesday after Epiphany
day_description: A weekday in the Christmas season, the liturgy continues to focus on the mysteries revealed during Christmastide.

day_title: Thursday after Epiphany
day_description: A weekday in the Christmas season, the liturgy continues to focus on the mysteries revealed during Christmastide.

day_title: Friday after Epiphany
day_description: A weekday in the Christmas season, the liturgy continues to focus on the mysteries revealed during Christmastide.

day_title: Saturday after Epiphany
day_description: A weekday in the Christmas season, the liturgy continues to focus on the mysteries revealed during Christmastide, often with an optional memorial of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

day_title: Feast of The Baptism of the Lord
day_description: This feast marks the end of the Christmas season and celebrates Jesus' baptism in the Jordan River by John the Baptist, an event that revealed his divine sonship and inaugurated his public ministry.

day_title: Monday of Week 1 in Ordinary Time
day_description: This day marks the beginning of Ordinary Time, a period in the liturgical year that focuses on the life and teachings of Jesus Christ in their everyday context.

day_title: Tuesday of Week 1 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Wednesday of Week 1 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Thursday of Week 1 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Antony, Abbot
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Antony the Great, an early Christian ascetic and hermit who is considered one of the Desert Fathers and a founder of monasticism.

day_title: Saturday of Week 1 in Ordinary Time (or Optional Memorial of the Blessed Virgin Mary)
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, which may also include an optional memorial in honor of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

day_title: Second Sunday in Ordinary Time
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time, focusing on the public ministry of Jesus Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saints Fabian, Pope and Martyr, or Saint Sebastian, Martyr
day_description: This optional memorial honors either Saint Fabian, a Pope martyred during the Decian persecution, or Saint Sebastian, a Roman martyr venerated for his faith and courage.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Agnes, Virgin and Martyr
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Agnes, a young Roman virgin and martyr of the early Church, revered for her purity and steadfast faith.

day_title: Day of Prayer for the Legal Protection of Unborn Children (USA) / Optional Memorial of Saint Vincent, Deacon and Martyr, or Saint Marianne Cope, Virgin
day_description: In the United States, this day is designated for prayer for the legal protection of unborn children. It also offers optional memorials for Saint Vincent, a deacon and martyr, or Saint Marianne Cope, who served lepers in Molokai.

day_title: Thursday of Week 2 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Francis de Sales, Bishop and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This memorial honors Saint Francis de Sales, a prominent bishop and Doctor of the Church, known for his spiritual writings, particularly on cultivating a devout life.

day_title: Feast of The Conversion of Saint Paul, Apostle
day_description: This feast celebrates the dramatic conversion of Saul (who became Paul) on the road to Damascus, an event central to the spread of Christianity.

day_title: Third Sunday in Ordinary Time (Sunday of the Word of God)
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time and is observed as the Sunday of the Word of God, emphasizing the importance of Scripture in the life of the Church.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Angela Merici, Virgin
day_description: This optional memorial commemorates Saint Angela Merici, who founded the Ursuline Order, dedicated to the education of girls.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Thomas Aquinas, Priest and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This memorial honors Saint Thomas Aquinas, one of the greatest theologians and philosophers in the Catholic tradition, known for his monumental work, the 'Summa Theologica'.

day_title: Wednesday of Week 3 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Thursday of Week 3 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Memorial of Saint John Bosco, Priest
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint John Bosco, an Italian priest who dedicated his life to the education and spiritual development of poor and abandoned children, founding the Salesian Society.

day_title: Saturday of Week 3 in Ordinary Time (or Optional Memorial of the Blessed Virgin Mary)
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, which may also include an optional memorial in honor of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

day_title: Feast of The Presentation of the Lord
day_description: This feast commemorates the presentation of Jesus in the Temple forty days after his birth, and the purification of Mary, according to Jewish law. It is also known as Candlemas.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Blaise, Bishop and Martyr, or Saint Ansgar, Bishop
day_description: This optional memorial honors either Saint Blaise, a bishop and martyr known for healing throat ailments, or Saint Ansgar, a missionary bishop who spread Christianity in Scandinavia.

day_title: Tuesday of Week 4 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Agatha, Virgin and Martyr
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Agatha, a virgin and martyr from Sicily, revered for her steadfast faith in the face of persecution.

day_title: Memorial of Saints Paul Miki and his Companions, Martyrs
day_description: This memorial honors Saints Paul Miki and his 25 companions, Japanese martyrs crucified for their faith in 1597.

day_title: Friday of Week 4 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Jerome Emiliani, or Saint Josephine Bakhita, Virgin
day_description: This optional memorial honors either Saint Jerome Emiliani, founder of the Somascan Fathers, known for his work with orphans, or Saint Josephine Bakhita, a Sudanese slave who became a Canossian sister.

day_title: Fifth Sunday in Ordinary Time
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time, focusing on the public ministry of Jesus Christ.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Scholastica, Virgin
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Scholastica, the twin sister of Saint Benedict, and a key figure in the early Benedictine monastic tradition for women.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Our Lady of Lourdes
day_description: This optional memorial commemorates the apparitions of the Blessed Virgin Mary to Saint Bernadette Soubirous at Lourdes, France, in 1858, a site of numerous miraculous healings.

day_title: Wednesday of Week 5 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Thursday of Week 5 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Memorial of Saints Cyril, Monk, and Methodius, Bishop
day_description: This memorial honors Saints Cyril and Methodius, brothers who were missionaries to the Slavs and developed the Glagolitic alphabet, becoming patrons of Europe.

day_title: Saturday of Week 5 in Ordinary Time (or Optional Memorial of the Blessed Virgin Mary)
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, which may also include an optional memorial in honor of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

day_title: Sixth Sunday in Ordinary Time
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time, focusing on the public ministry of Jesus Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of The Seven Holy Founders of the Servite Order
day_description: This optional memorial commemorates the seven Florentine merchants who founded the Servite Order in the 13th century, dedicated to the Blessed Virgin Mary.

day_title: Tuesday of Week 6 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Wednesday of Week 6 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Thursday of Week 6 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Peter Damian, Bishop and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Peter Damian, an 11th-century cardinal, monastic reformer, and Doctor of the Church known for his writings and efforts against simony.

day_title: Feast of The Chair of Saint Peter the Apostle
day_description: This feast celebrates the papacy, symbolizing the authority and unity of the Church rooted in the Apostle Peter and his successors.

day_title: Seventh Sunday in Ordinary Time
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time, focusing on the public ministry of Jesus Christ.

day_title: Monday of Week 7 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Tuesday of Week 7 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Wednesday of Week 7 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Gregory of Narek, Abbot and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Gregory of Narek, a 10th-century Armenian monk, poet, and mystic, known for his spiritual writings, particularly the 'Book of Lamentations'.

day_title: Friday of Week 7 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Saturday of Week 7 in Ordinary Time (or Optional Memorial of the Blessed Virgin Mary)
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, which may also include an optional memorial in honor of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

day_title: Eighth Sunday in Ordinary Time
day_description: This Sunday marks the final Sunday in Ordinary Time before the commencement of Lent.

day_title: Monday of Week 8 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Casimir
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Casimir, a 15th-century Polish prince revered for his piety, humility, and dedication to the poor.

day_title: Ash Wednesday (Day of Fast and Abstinence)
day_description: Ash Wednesday marks the beginning of Lent, a solemn season of prayer, penance, fasting, and almsgiving in preparation for Easter. Ashes are distributed to symbolize repentance and mortality.

day_title: Thursday after Ash Wednesday
day_description: The first full day of Lent, continuing the penitential spirit and focus on conversion.

day_title: Friday after Ash Wednesday (Commemoration of Saints Perpetua and Felicity, Martyrs)
day_description: A Lenten weekday, also commemorating Saints Perpetua and Felicity, early Christian martyrs revered for their unwavering faith.

day_title: Saturday after Ash Wednesday (Commemoration of Saint John of God, Religious)
day_description: A Lenten weekday, also commemorating Saint John of God, founder of the Brothers Hospitallers, known for his care of the sick and needy.

day_title: First Sunday of Lent
day_description: This Sunday initiates the first full week of Lent, inviting the faithful to deeper spiritual reflection and penitential practices.

day_title: Monday of the 1st Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the first week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Tuesday of the 1st Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the first week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Wednesday of the 1st Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the first week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Thursday of the 1st Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the first week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Friday of the 1st Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the first week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Saturday of the 1st Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the first week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Second Sunday of Lent
day_description: This Sunday in Lent focuses on the Transfiguration of Jesus, a pivotal moment revealing his divine glory and foreshadowing his resurrection.

day_title: Monday of the 2nd Week of Lent (Commemoration of Saint Patrick, Bishop)
day_description: A Lenten weekday, also commemorating Saint Patrick, the patron saint of Ireland, known for evangelizing the Irish people.

day_title: Tuesday of the 2nd Week of Lent (Commemoration of Saint Cyril of Jerusalem, Bishop and Doctor of the Church)
day_description: A Lenten weekday, also commemorating Saint Cyril of Jerusalem, a bishop and Doctor of the Church, known for his catechetical instructions.

day_title: Solemnity of Saint Joseph, Spouse of the Blessed Virgin Mary
day_description: This Solemnity honors Saint Joseph, the foster father of Jesus and the husband of the Blessed Virgin Mary, revered as a model of faith, humility, and obedience.

day_title: Thursday of the 2nd Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the second week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Friday of the 2nd Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the second week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Saturday of the 2nd Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the second week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Third Sunday of Lent
day_description: This Sunday in Lent often features Gospel readings that highlight the theme of living water or spiritual thirst, preparing catechumens for baptism.

day_title: Monday of the 3rd Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the third week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Solemnity of The Annunciation of the Lord
day_description: This Solemnity celebrates the angel Gabriel's announcement to the Blessed Virgin Mary that she would conceive and bear the Son of God, marking the Incarnation of Jesus Christ.

day_title: Wednesday of the 3rd Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the third week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Thursday of the 3rd Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the third week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Friday of the 3rd Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the third week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Saturday of the 3rd Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the third week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Fourth Sunday of Lent (Laetare Sunday)
day_description: This Sunday, known as Laetare Sunday, offers a slight reprieve from the penitential nature of Lent, symbolizing hope and joy in the midst of fasting and abstinence as Easter approaches.

day_title: Monday of the 4th Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the fourth week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Tuesday of the 4th Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the fourth week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Wednesday of the 4th Week of Lent (Commemoration of Saint Francis of Paola, Hermit)
day_description: A Lenten weekday, also commemorating Saint Francis of Paola, a hermit and founder of the Minim friars, known for his austere life and miracles.

day_title: Thursday of the 4th Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the fourth week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Friday of the 4th Week of Lent (Commemoration of Saint Isidore, Bishop and Doctor of the Church)
day_description: A Lenten weekday, also commemorating Saint Isidore of Seville, a bishop and Doctor of the Church, known for his encyclopedic writings and influence on medieval learning.

day_title: Saturday of the 4th Week of Lent (Commemoration of Saint Vincent Ferrer, Priest)
day_description: A Lenten weekday, also commemorating Saint Vincent Ferrer, a Dominican friar and missionary known for his preaching during the Western Schism.

day_title: Fifth Sunday of Lent
day_description: This Sunday in Lent marks a heightened focus on the Passion of Christ, with readings that anticipate his suffering and death.

day_title: Monday of the 5th Week of Lent (Commemoration of Saint John Baptist de la Salle, Priest)
day_description: A Lenten weekday, also commemorating Saint John Baptist de la Salle, founder of the Brothers of the Christian Schools, a pioneer in modern education.

day_title: Tuesday of the 5th Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the fifth week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Wednesday of the 5th Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the fifth week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Thursday of the 5th Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the fifth week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Friday of the 5th Week of Lent (Commemoration of Saint Stanislaus, Bishop and Martyr)
day_description: A Lenten weekday, also commemorating Saint Stanislaus, a Polish bishop and martyr, patron saint of Poland.

day_title: Saturday of the 5th Week of Lent
day_description: A weekday in the fifth week of Lent, continuing the call to repentance and spiritual discipline.

day_title: Palm Sunday of the Passion of the Lord
day_description: This Sunday marks the beginning of Holy Week, commemorating Jesus' triumphant entry into Jerusalem and the reading of the Passion narrative.

day_title: Monday of Holy Week
day_description: The first day of Holy Week, leading up to the Easter Triduum, with readings reflecting on the final days of Jesus' earthly life.

day_title: Tuesday of Holy Week
day_description: A day in Holy Week, continuing the solemn preparation for the Easter Triduum.

day_title: Wednesday of Holy Week
day_description: A day in Holy Week, continuing the solemn preparation for the Easter Triduum.

day_title: Holy Thursday of the Lord's Supper (Chrism Mass typically celebrated)
day_description: Holy Thursday commemorates the Last Supper, the institution of the Eucharist and the Priesthood, and the washing of the feet. It initiates the Paschal Triduum.

day_title: Friday of the Passion of the Lord (Good Friday - Day of Fast and Abstinence)
day_description: Good Friday is the solemn commemoration of the Passion, Crucifixion, and Death of Jesus Christ. It is a day of strict fasting and abstinence, with no Mass celebrated.

day_title: Holy Saturday (The Easter Vigil in the Holy Night)
day_description: Holy Saturday is a day of reflection and anticipation, leading up to the Easter Vigil, the most important liturgy of the entire liturgical year, celebrating the Resurrection of Christ.

day_title: Easter Sunday of the Resurrection of the Lord (Solemnity)
day_description: Easter Sunday is the greatest feast in the Christian calendar, celebrating the Resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead, which is the foundation of Christian faith and hope.

day_title: Monday in the Octave of Easter
day_description: The first day of the Easter Octave, continuing the joyous celebration of Christ's Resurrection.

day_title: Tuesday in the Octave of Easter
day_description: A day within the Easter Octave, continuing the joyous celebration of Christ's Resurrection.

day_title: Wednesday in the Octave of Easter
day_description: A day within the Easter Octave, continuing the joyous celebration of Christ's Resurrection.

day_title: Thursday in the Octave of Easter
day_description: A day within the Easter Octave, continuing the joyous celebration of Christ's Resurrection.

day_title: Feast of Saint Mark, Evangelist
day_description: This feast commemorates Saint Mark the Evangelist, traditionally attributed with writing the Gospel of Mark.

day_title: Saturday in the Octave of Easter
day_description: The final day within the Easter Octave, concluding a week of intense celebration of the Resurrection.

day_title: Second Sunday of Easter (or Divine Mercy Sunday)
day_description: This Sunday concludes the Octave of Easter and is also celebrated as Divine Mercy Sunday, emphasizing God's boundless mercy, as revealed to Saint Faustina Kowalska.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Peter Chanel, Priest and Martyr, or Saint Louis Marie Grignion de Montfort, Priest
day_description: This optional memorial honors either Saint Peter Chanel, a French Marist priest and the first martyr of Oceania, or Saint Louis Marie Grignion de Montfort, a French priest known for his Marian devotion.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Catherine of Siena, Virgin and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Catherine of Siena, a Dominican tertiary, mystic, and Doctor of the Church, known for her spiritual writings and her efforts to reform the Church.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Pius V, Pope
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Pius V, a Pope of the 16th century who implemented the reforms of the Council of Trent and organized the Holy League that won the Battle of Lepanto.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Joseph the Worker
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Joseph in his role as a laborer, emphasizing the dignity of work and the importance of family life.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Athanasius, Bishop and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Athanasius, a 4th-century bishop and Doctor of the Church, a staunch defender of the divinity of Christ against Arianism.

day_title: Feast of Saints Philip and James, Apostles
day_description: This feast commemorates two of Jesus' apostles, Saint Philip and Saint James the Less, important figures in the early Church.

day_title: Third Sunday of Easter
day_description: This Sunday continues the Easter season, focusing on the appearances of the Risen Christ to his disciples.

day_title: Monday of Week 3 of Easter
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, continuing the celebration of Christ's Resurrection.

day_title: Tuesday of Week 3 of Easter
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, continuing the celebration of Christ's Resurrection.

day_title: Wednesday of Week 3 of Easter
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, continuing the celebration of Christ's Resurrection.

day_title: Thursday of Week 3 of Easter
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, continuing the celebration of Christ's Resurrection.

day_title: Friday of Week 3 of Easter
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, continuing the celebration of Christ's Resurrection.

day_title: Saturday of Week 3 of Easter (or Optional Memorial of the Blessed Virgin Mary)
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, which may also include an optional memorial in honor of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

day_title: Fourth Sunday of Easter (Good Shepherd Sunday / World Day of Prayer for Vocations)
day_description: This Sunday is known as Good Shepherd Sunday, with Gospel readings focusing on Jesus as the Good Shepherd. It is also the World Day of Prayer for Vocations.

day_title: Monday of Week 4 of Easter
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, continuing the celebration of Christ's Resurrection.

day_title: Tuesday of Week 4 of Easter (Optional Memorial of Our Lady of Fatima)
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, which may also include an optional memorial commemorating the apparitions of the Blessed Virgin Mary at Fatima, Portugal, in 1917.

day_title: Feast of Saint Matthias, Apostle
day_description: This feast commemorates Saint Matthias, who was chosen by the apostles to replace Judas Iscariot among the twelve.

day_title: Thursday of Week 4 of Easter
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, continuing the celebration of Christ's Resurrection.

day_title: Friday of Week 4 of Easter
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, continuing the celebration of Christ's Resurrection.

day_title: Saturday of Week 4 of Easter (or Optional Memorial of the Blessed Virgin Mary)
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, which may also include an optional memorial in honor of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

day_title: Fifth Sunday of Easter
day_description: This Sunday continues the Easter season, focusing on the teachings of the Risen Christ and the mission of the Church.

day_title: Monday of Week 5 of Easter
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, continuing the celebration of Christ's Resurrection.

day_title: Tuesday of Week 5 of Easter (Optional Memorial of Saint Bernardine of Siena, Priest)
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, which may also include an optional memorial commemorating Saint Bernardine of Siena, a Franciscan preacher known for promoting devotion to the Holy Name of Jesus.

day_title: Wednesday of Week 5 of Easter (Optional Memorial of Saint Christopher Magallanes and Companions, Martyrs)
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, which may also include an optional memorial honoring Saint Christopher Magallanes and his 24 companion martyrs from Mexico.

day_title: Thursday of Week 5 of Easter (Optional Memorial of Saint Rita of Cascia, Religious)
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, which may also include an optional memorial commemorating Saint Rita of Cascia, an Augustinian nun known as the patroness of impossible causes.

day_title: Friday of Week 5 of Easter
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, continuing the celebration of Christ's Resurrection.

day_title: Saturday of Week 5 of Easter (Optional Memorial of the Blessed Virgin Mary, Help of Christians)
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, which may also include an optional memorial honoring the Blessed Virgin Mary under the title of Help of Christians.

day_title: Sixth Sunday of Easter
day_description: This Sunday continues the Easter season, focusing on the teachings of the Risen Christ and the coming of the Holy Spirit.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Philip Neri, Priest
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Philip Neri, a joyful Italian priest known for founding the Oratory and his ministry to the poor and pilgrims in Rome.

day_title: Tuesday of Week 6 of Easter (Optional Memorial of Saint Augustine of Canterbury, Bishop)
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, which may also include an optional memorial commemorating Saint Augustine of Canterbury, known as the 'Apostle to the English' for his missionary work.

day_title: Wednesday of Week 6 of Easter
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, continuing the celebration of Christ's Resurrection.

day_title: Solemnity of The Ascension of the Lord (Holy Day of Obligation in some dioceses; transferred to Sunday, June 1, in others)
day_description: This Solemnity commemorates Jesus' bodily Ascension into heaven forty days after his Resurrection. In some U.S. dioceses, it is transferred to the following Sunday.

day_title: Friday of Week 6 of Easter
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, continuing the celebration of Christ's Resurrection.

day_title: Feast of The Visitation of the Blessed Virgin Mary
day_description: This feast celebrates the visit of the Blessed Virgin Mary to her cousin Elizabeth, as recorded in the Gospel of Luke.

day_title: Seventh Sunday of Easter (or Solemnity of The Ascension of the Lord, if transferred)
day_description: This Sunday marks the seventh week of Easter. In dioceses where the Ascension of the Lord is transferred, it is celebrated today, fulfilling the Holy Day of Obligation.

day_title: Monday of Week 7 of Easter (Optional Memorial of Saints Marcellinus and Peter, Martyrs, or Saint Erasmus, Bishop and Martyr)
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, which may also include an optional memorial commemorating various early Christian martyrs.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Charles Lwanga and Companions, Martyrs
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Charles Lwanga and his 21 companions, Ugandan martyrs who were executed for their Christian faith in the late 19th century.

day_title: Wednesday of Week 7 of Easter
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, continuing the celebration of Christ's Resurrection.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Boniface, Bishop and Martyr
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Boniface, an English Benedictine monk and missionary known as the 'Apostle of Germany' for his evangelizing work in the 8th century.

day_title: Friday of Week 7 of Easter (Optional Memorial of Saint Norbert, Bishop)
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, which may also include an optional memorial commemorating Saint Norbert, founder of the Premonstratensian Order.

day_title: Saturday of Week 7 of Easter (or Optional Memorial of the Blessed Virgin Mary)
day_description: A weekday within the Easter season, which may also include an optional memorial in honor of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

day_title: Solemnity of Pentecost Sunday
day_description: Pentecost Sunday celebrates the descent of the Holy Spirit upon the Apostles, marking the birth of the Church and the end of the Easter season.

day_title: Memorial of the Blessed Virgin Mary, Mother of the Church
day_description: This memorial celebrates the Blessed Virgin Mary as the Mother of the Church, highlighting her maternal role in the life of believers.

day_title: Tuesday of Week 10 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Barnabas, Apostle
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Barnabas, an early Christian missionary and companion of Saint Paul, who is considered an apostle.

day_title: Thursday of Week 10 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Anthony of Padua, Priest and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This memorial honors Saint Anthony of Padua, a Franciscan friar and Doctor of the Church, renowned for his preaching, knowledge of Scripture, and miracles.

day_title: Saturday of Week 10 in Ordinary Time (or Optional Memorial of the Blessed Virgin Mary)
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, which may also include an optional memorial in honor of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

day_title: Solemnity of The Most Holy Trinity
day_description: This Solemnity celebrates the central mystery of the Christian faith: God as one God in three divine Persons â€“ Father, Son, and Holy Spirit.

day_title: Monday of Week 11 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Tuesday of Week 11 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Wednesday of Week 11 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Thursday of Week 11 in Ordinary Time (Optional Memorial of Saint Romuald, Abbot)
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, which may also include an optional memorial commemorating Saint Romuald, an Italian hermit who founded the Camaldolese order.

day_title: Friday of Week 11 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Aloysius Gonzaga, Religious
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Aloysius Gonzaga, a young Jesuit novice known for his piety and care for the sick, who died serving plague victims.

day_title: Solemnity of The Most Holy Body and Blood of Christ (Corpus Christi)
day_description: This Solemnity celebrates the Real Presence of Jesus Christ in the Eucharist, truly present under the appearances of bread and wine.

day_title: Monday of Week 12 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Solemnity of The Nativity of Saint John the Baptist
day_description: This Solemnity celebrates the birth of Saint John the Baptist, the precursor of Jesus, who prepared the way for the Lord.

day_title: Wednesday of Week 12 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Thursday of Week 12 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Solemnity of The Most Sacred Heart of Jesus
day_description: This Solemnity honors the Sacred Heart of Jesus, symbolizing his divine love for humanity, especially as revealed in his suffering and death.

day_title: Memorial of the Immaculate Heart of Mary (or Optional Memorial of Saint Irenaeus, Bishop and Martyr, Doctor of the Church)
day_description: This memorial celebrates the Immaculate Heart of Mary, a symbol of her virtues and her pure, undivided love for God and humanity. It may also be an optional memorial for Saint Irenaeus, an early Church Father.

day_title: Solemnity of Saints Peter and Paul, Apostles
day_description: This Solemnity commemorates the martyrdom of two foundational apostles, Saint Peter and Saint Paul, recognizing their pivotal roles in the establishment of the Christian Church.

day_title: Monday of Week 13 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Junipero Serra, Priest
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Junipero Serra, a Franciscan missionary who founded missions in California and evangelized Native Americans.

day_title: Wednesday of Week 13 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Feast of Saint Thomas, Apostle
day_description: This feast commemorates Saint Thomas, one of the twelve apostles, known for his initial doubt about Jesus' resurrection and his eventual profession of faith.

day_title: Friday of Week 13 in Ordinary Time (Independence Day in the USA)
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time. In the United States, this is Independence Day, a civic holiday. Masses may be offered for the country or for peace and justice.

day_title: Saturday of Week 13 in Ordinary Time (Optional Memorial of Saint Anthony Zaccaria, Priest, or Saint Elizabeth of Portugal)
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, which may also include an optional memorial commemorating Saint Anthony Zaccaria, founder of the Barnabites, or Saint Elizabeth of Portugal, a queen known for her charity.

day_title: Fourteenth Sunday in Ordinary Time (Day of Penance for sins and crimes against children and youth - Diocese of Sacramento)
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time. In some dioceses, like Sacramento, it is a special Day of Penance for sins and crimes against children and youth.

day_title: Monday of Week 14 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Tuesday of Week 14 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Augustine Zhao Rong and Companions, Martyrs
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Augustine Zhao Rong and his 119 companion martyrs, Chinese Christians persecuted for their faith.

day_title: Thursday of Week 14 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Benedict, Abbot
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Benedict of Nursia, the founder of Western monasticism and author of the Benedictine Rule, revered as the patron saint of Europe.

day_title: Saturday of Week 14 in Ordinary Time (Optional Memorial of the Blessed Virgin Mary)
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, which may also include an optional memorial in honor of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

day_title: Fifteenth Sunday in Ordinary Time
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time, focusing on the public ministry of Jesus Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Kateri Tekakwitha, Virgin
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Kateri Tekakwitha, a Native American virgin known for her piety and devotion to Christ, the first Native American saint.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Bonaventure, Bishop and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Bonaventure, a Franciscan friar and Doctor of the Church, known as the 'Seraphic Doctor' for his theological and mystical writings.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Our Lady of Mount Carmel
day_description: This optional memorial commemorates Our Lady of Mount Carmel, honoring the Blessed Virgin Mary as the patroness of the Carmelite Order and an advocate for souls in Purgatory.

day_title: Thursday of Week 15 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Friday of Week 15 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Saturday of Week 15 in Ordinary Time (Optional Memorial of the Blessed Virgin Mary)
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, which may also include an optional memorial in honor of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

day_title: Sixteenth Sunday in Ordinary Time
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time, focusing on the public ministry of Jesus Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Lawrence of Brindisi, Priest and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Lawrence of Brindisi, a Capuchin friar and Doctor of the Church, known for his preaching and diplomatic skills.

day_title: Feast of Saint Mary Magdalene
day_description: This feast commemorates Saint Mary Magdalene, one of Jesus' most devoted followers, who was present at his crucifixion and was the first witness to his resurrection.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Bridget, Religious
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Bridget of Sweden, a mystic and founder of the Bridgettine Order, known for her visions and political influence.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Sharbel Makhluf, Priest
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Sharbel Makhluf, a Maronite monk and hermit from Lebanon, known for his ascetic life and miracles after his death.

day_title: Feast of Saint James, Apostle
day_description: This feast commemorates Saint James the Greater, one of the twelve apostles, son of Zebedee and brother of Saint John, traditionally associated with Spain.

day_title: Memorial of Saints Joachim and Anne, Parents of the Blessed Virgin Mary
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saints Joachim and Anne, the traditional parents of the Blessed Virgin Mary, revered as grandparents of Jesus.

day_title: Seventeenth Sunday in Ordinary Time
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time, focusing on the public ministry of Jesus Christ.

day_title: Monday of Week 18 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Martha, Mary, and Lazarus
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saints Martha, Mary, and Lazarus, siblings from Bethany who were close friends of Jesus and hosted him in their home.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Peter Chrysologus, Bishop and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Peter Chrysologus, a 5th-century bishop and Doctor of the Church, known for his eloquent sermons.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Ignatius of Loyola, Priest
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Ignatius of Loyola, the founder of the Society of Jesus (Jesuits), known for his spiritual exercises and commitment to apostolic work.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Alphonsus Liguori, Bishop and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Alphonsus Liguori, an 18th-century bishop and Doctor of the Church, founder of the Redemptorists, known for his moral theology.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Eusebius of Vercelli, Bishop, or Saint Peter Julian Eymard, Priest
day_description: This optional memorial honors either Saint Eusebius of Vercelli, a 4th-century bishop who defended Nicene orthodoxy, or Saint Peter Julian Eymard, founder of the Congregation of the Blessed Sacrament.

day_title: Eighteenth Sunday in Ordinary Time
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time, focusing on the public ministry of Jesus Christ.

day_title: Memorial of Saint John Vianney, Priest
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint John Vianney, the CurÃ© of Ars, a French priest renowned for his pastoral zeal, dedication to the Sacrament of Reconciliation, and holiness.

day_title: Optional Memorial of The Dedication of the Basilica of Saint Mary Major
day_description: This optional memorial celebrates the dedication of the Basilica of Saint Mary Major in Rome, one of the four papal basilicas, dedicated to the Blessed Virgin Mary.

day_title: Feast of The Transfiguration of the Lord
day_description: This feast commemorates the Transfiguration of Jesus on Mount Tabor, where he revealed his divine glory to Peter, James, and John, foreshadowing his resurrection.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Sixtus II, Pope and Martyrs, or Saint Cajetan, Priest
day_description: This optional memorial honors either Saint Sixtus II and his companions, martyrs of the 3rd century, or Saint Cajetan, a priest who founded the Theatine Order.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Dominic, Priest
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Dominic, the founder of the Order of Preachers (Dominicans), known for his zeal in preaching and combating heresy.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Teresa Benedicta of the Cross (Edith Stein), Virgin and Martyr
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Teresa Benedicta of the Cross (Edith Stein), a Jewish philosopher who converted to Catholicism, became a Carmelite nun, and was martyred in Auschwitz.

day_title: Nineteenth Sunday in Ordinary Time (or Feast of Saint Lawrence, Deacon and Martyr)
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time. If August 10 falls on a weekday, it is the Feast of Saint Lawrence, a deacon and martyr known for his heroic charity.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Clare, Virgin
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Clare of Assisi, a close follower of Saint Francis of Assisi and the founder of the Poor Clares, known for her life of poverty and prayer.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Jane Frances de Chantal, Religious
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Jane Frances de Chantal, who, with Saint Francis de Sales, founded the Order of the Visitation of Holy Mary.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saints Pontian, Pope and Martyr, and Hippolytus, Priest and Martyr
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saints Pontian, a Pope exiled and martyred, and Hippolytus, a priest who initially opposed Pontian but reconciled with him, both martyred together.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Maximillian Kolbe, Priest and Martyr
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Maximillian Kolbe, a Franciscan friar who offered his life in exchange for another prisoner at Auschwitz during World War II.

day_title: Solemnity of The Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary (Holy Day of Obligation)
day_description: This Solemnity celebrates the belief that the Blessed Virgin Mary, at the end of her earthly life, was assumed body and soul into heavenly glory.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Stephen of Hungary
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Stephen of Hungary, the first Christian king of Hungary, who played a crucial role in establishing Christianity in his kingdom.

day_title: Twentieth Sunday in Ordinary Time
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time, focusing on the public ministry of Jesus Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Helena
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Helena, mother of Emperor Constantine, known for her pilgrimage to the Holy Land and discovery of relics of the True Cross.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint John Eudes, Priest
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint John Eudes, a French priest who founded the Congregation of Jesus and Mary and promoted devotion to the Sacred Hearts of Jesus and Mary.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Bernard, Abbot and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Bernard of Clairvaux, a Cistercian abbot and Doctor of the Church, a key figure in monastic reform and a renowned preacher of the Crusades.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Pius X, Pope
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Pius X, a Pope known for his pastoral and doctrinal reforms, particularly his promotion of frequent communion.

day_title: Memorial of The Queenship of the Blessed Virgin Mary
day_description: This memorial celebrates the Blessed Virgin Mary's queenship over heaven and earth, a recognition of her unique role as the Mother of God and Queen of all creation.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Rose of Lima, Virgin
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Rose of Lima, the first canonized saint of the Americas, known for her ascetic life and devotion to prayer.

day_title: Twenty-First Sunday in Ordinary Time (or Feast of Saint Bartholomew, Apostle)
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time. If August 24 falls on a weekday, it is the Feast of Saint Bartholomew, one of the twelve apostles, traditionally identified with Nathanael.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Louis, or Saint Joseph Calasanz, Priest
day_description: This optional memorial honors either Saint Louis IX, King of France, known for his piety and justice, or Saint Joseph Calasanz, who founded the Piarist Order for the education of poor children.

day_title: Tuesday of Week 21 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Monica
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Monica, the mother of Saint Augustine of Hippo, known for her persistent prayers for her son's conversion.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Augustine, Bishop and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Augustine of Hippo, one of the most influential Church Fathers and Doctors of the Church, known for his theological writings and his autobiography, 'Confessions'.

day_title: Memorial of The Passion of Saint John the Baptist
day_description: This memorial commemorates the martyrdom of Saint John the Baptist, beheaded at the request of Herodias' daughter Salome.

day_title: Saturday of Week 21 in Ordinary Time (Optional Memorial of the Blessed Virgin Mary)
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, which may also include an optional memorial in honor of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

day_title: Twenty-Second Sunday in Ordinary Time
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time, focusing on the public ministry of Jesus Christ.

day_title: World Day of Prayer for the Care of Creation
day_description: This day is dedicated to prayer for the protection of creation and for renewed efforts to care for the environment, emphasizing our responsibility as stewards of God's gift.

day_title: Tuesday of Week 22 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Gregory the Great, Pope and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Gregory the Great, a Pope and Doctor of the Church who made significant contributions to the liturgy, monasticism, and the spiritual life of the Church.

day_title: Thursday of Week 22 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Friday of Week 22 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Saturday of Week 22 in Ordinary Time (Optional Memorial of the Blessed Virgin Mary)
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, which may also include an optional memorial in honor of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

day_title: Twenty-Third Sunday in Ordinary Time
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time, focusing on the public ministry of Jesus Christ.

day_title: Feast of The Nativity of the Blessed Virgin Mary
day_description: This feast celebrates the birth of the Blessed Virgin Mary, marking a significant step in the history of salvation as she was chosen to be the Mother of God.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Peter Claver, Priest
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Peter Claver, a Jesuit priest who ministered to enslaved Africans arriving in Cartagena, Colombia, during the 17th century.

day_title: Wednesday of Week 23 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Thursday of Week 23 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of The Most Holy Name of Mary
day_description: This optional memorial encourages devotion to the Holy Name of Mary, emphasizing the reverence and importance of her name.

day_title: Memorial of Saint John Chrysostom, Bishop and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint John Chrysostom, a 4th-century Archbishop of Constantinople and Doctor of the Church, known for his eloquent preaching, earning him the title 'Golden-mouthed'.

day_title: Feast of The Exaltation of the Holy Cross
day_description: This feast celebrates the Cross as the instrument of salvation, commemorating its recovery by Saint Helena and its veneration.

day_title: Memorial of Our Lady of Sorrows
day_description: This memorial commemorates the Seven Sorrows of the Blessed Virgin Mary, particularly her suffering at the foot of the Cross during her Son's Passion.

day_title: Memorial of Saints Cornelius, Pope and Martyr, and Cyprian, Bishop and Martyr
day_description: This memorial honors Saints Cornelius and Cyprian, two 3rd-century martyrs who championed the unity of the Church and suffered persecution for their faith.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Robert Bellarmine, Bishop and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Robert Bellarmine, a Jesuit cardinal and Doctor of the Church, known for his theological writings and defense of the Catholic faith during the Counter-Reformation.

day_title: Thursday of Week 24 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Friday of Week 24 in Ordinary Time (Optional Memorial of Saint Januarius, Bishop and Martyr)
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, which may also include an optional memorial commemorating Saint Januarius, a bishop and martyr of Naples, known for the liquefaction of his blood.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Andrew Kim Taegon, Priest and Martyr, Paul Chong Hasang and Companions, Martyrs
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Andrew Kim Taegon, the first native Korean priest, and his companions, who were martyred for their faith in Korea.

day_title: Twenty-Fifth Sunday in Ordinary Time (or Feast of Saint Matthew, Apostle and Evangelist)
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time. If September 21 falls on a weekday, it is the Feast of Saint Matthew, one of the twelve apostles and evangelists, traditionally attributed with writing the Gospel of Matthew.

day_title: Monday of Week 25 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Pio of Pietrelcina (Padre Pio), Priest
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Pio of Pietrelcina, an Italian Capuchin friar and mystic, known for bearing the stigmata and his spiritual guidance.

day_title: Wednesday of Week 25 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Thursday of Week 25 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saints Cosmas and Damian, Martyrs
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saints Cosmas and Damian, twin brothers and physicians who practiced medicine without charge and were martyred for their Christian faith.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Vincent de Paul, Priest
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Vincent de Paul, a French priest renowned for his charitable work among the poor and marginalized, and founder of the Vincentians and Daughters of Charity.

day_title: Twenty-Sixth Sunday in Ordinary Time
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time, focusing on the public ministry of Jesus Christ.

day_title: Feast of Saints Michael, Gabriel, and Raphael, Archangels
day_description: This feast celebrates the three Archangels mentioned in Scripture: Michael, the defender against evil; Gabriel, the messenger of God; and Raphael, the healer and guide.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Jerome, Priest and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Jerome, a priest and Doctor of the Church, best known for translating the Bible into Latin (the Vulgate).

day_title: Memorial of Saint ThÃ©rÃ¨se of the Child Jesus, Virgin and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint ThÃ©rÃ¨se of Lisieux, a Carmelite nun and Doctor of the Church, known for her 'Little Way' of spiritual childhood and trust in God's love.

day_title: Memorial of The Guardian Angels
day_description: This memorial honors the Guardian Angels, acknowledging their role as spiritual protectors and guides given to each person by God.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Francis Borgia, Priest
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Francis Borgia, a Spanish duke who became a Jesuit priest and later the third Superior General of the Society of Jesus.

day_title: Feast of Saint Francis of Assisi
day_description: This feast celebrates Saint Francis of Assisi, the founder of the Franciscan Order, known for his love of poverty, nature, and peace.

day_title: Twenty-Seventh Sunday in Ordinary Time
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time, focusing on the public ministry of Jesus Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Bruno, Priest, or Saint Blessed Marie Rose Durocher, Virgin
day_description: This optional memorial honors either Saint Bruno, founder of the Carthusian Order, known for its strict contemplative life, or Blessed Marie Rose Durocher, founder of the Sisters of the Holy Names of Jesus and Mary.

day_title: Memorial of Our Lady of the Rosary
day_description: This memorial celebrates Our Lady of the Rosary, commemorating the victory at the Battle of Lepanto and promoting the devotion of the Holy Rosary.

day_title: Wednesday of Week 27 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Denis and Companions, Martyrs, or Saint John Leonardi, Priest
day_description: This optional memorial honors either Saint Denis and his companions, martyrs of Paris, or Saint John Leonardi, who founded the Clerks Regular of the Mother of God.

day_title: Friday of Week 27 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint John XXIII, Pope
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint John XXIII, a Pope known for convoking the Second Vatican Council and initiating significant reforms in the Church.

day_title: Twenty-Eighth Sunday in Ordinary Time
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time, focusing on the public ministry of Jesus Christ.

day_title: Monday of Week 28 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Callistus I, Pope and Martyr
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Callistus I, a 3rd-century Pope and martyr known for his efforts to integrate sinners back into the Church.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Teresa of Jesus (of Ãvila), Virgin and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Teresa of Ãvila, a Carmelite nun and Doctor of the Church, a prominent mystic and reformer of the Carmelite Order.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Hedwig, Religious, or Saint Margaret Mary Alacoque, Virgin
day_description: This optional memorial honors either Saint Hedwig, a duchess known for her charity and asceticism, or Saint Margaret Mary Alacoque, a Visitation nun who promoted devotion to the Sacred Heart of Jesus.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Ignatius of Antioch, Bishop and Martyr
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Ignatius of Antioch, an early Church bishop and martyr, known for his letters written on his way to martyrdom.

day_title: Feast of Saint Luke, Evangelist
day_description: This feast commemorates Saint Luke the Evangelist, traditionally attributed with writing the Gospel of Luke and the Acts of the Apostles, and considered a physician.

day_title: Twenty-Ninth Sunday in Ordinary Time (World Mission Sunday)
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time and is observed as World Mission Sunday, an annual event encouraging prayer and financial support for Catholic missions worldwide.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Paul of the Cross, Priest
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Paul of the Cross, an Italian priest who founded the Passionists, dedicated to meditating on the Passion of Christ.

day_title: Tuesday of Week 29 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint John Paul II, Pope
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint John Paul II, a beloved Pope known for his extensive travels, strong moral stances, and instrumental role in the fall of communism.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint John of Capistrano, Priest
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint John of Capistrano, a Franciscan friar and preacher who led crusades against the Ottoman Turks.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Anthony Mary Claret, Bishop
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Anthony Mary Claret, a Spanish bishop and founder of the Claretian missionaries, known for his evangelical zeal.

day_title: Saturday of Week 29 in Ordinary Time (Optional Memorial of the Blessed Virgin Mary)
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, which may also include an optional memorial in honor of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

day_title: Thirtieth Sunday in Ordinary Time
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time, focusing on the public ministry of Jesus Christ.

day_title: Monday of Week 30 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Feast of Saints Simon and Jude, Apostles
day_description: This feast commemorates Saints Simon and Jude Thaddeus, two of the twelve apostles of Jesus.

day_title: Wednesday of Week 30 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Thursday of Week 30 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Friday of Week 30 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Solemnity of All Saints (Not a Holy Day of Obligation this year)
day_description: This Solemnity honors all the saints, known and unknown, who are in heaven, celebrating their holiness and their intercession for us. When it falls on a Saturday or Monday, the obligation to attend Mass is abrogated in the U.S.

day_title: The Commemoration of All the Faithful Departed (All Souls' Day)
day_description: This day is dedicated to praying for all the faithful departed, especially those in Purgatory, offering Masses and prayers for their purification and eternal rest.

day_title: Monday of Week 31 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Charles Borromeo, Bishop
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Charles Borromeo, a cardinal and Archbishop of Milan, a leading figure in the Counter-Reformation and a model of episcopal reform.

day_title: Wednesday of Week 31 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Thursday of Week 31 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Friday of Week 31 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Saturday of Week 31 in Ordinary Time (Optional Memorial of the Blessed Virgin Mary)
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, which may also include an optional memorial in honor of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

day_title: Feast of The Dedication of the Lateran Basilica
day_description: This feast celebrates the dedication of the Archbasilica of Saint John Lateran in Rome, the cathedral of the Pope and the mother church of all churches in the world.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Leo the Great, Pope and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Leo the Great, a 5th-century Pope and Doctor of the Church, known for his theological writings and his role in defending the Church against heresies.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Martin of Tours, Bishop
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Martin of Tours, a 4th-century bishop and patron saint of soldiers, known for his generosity and evangelization.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Josaphat, Bishop and Martyr
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Josaphat, a Basilian monk and bishop who was martyred for his efforts to unite the Ruthenian Orthodox Church with Rome.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Frances Xavier Cabrini, Virgin (USA)
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Frances Xavier Cabrini, the first American citizen to be canonized, known for her missionary work among immigrants and her founding of the Missionary Sisters of the Sacred Heart of Jesus.

day_title: Friday of Week 32 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Saturday of Week 32 in Ordinary Time (Optional Memorial of Saint Albert the Great, Bishop and Doctor of the Church)
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, which may also include an optional memorial commemorating Saint Albert the Great, a Dominican friar and Doctor of the Church, known for his wide-ranging scholarship.

day_title: Thirty-Third Sunday in Ordinary Time
day_description: This Sunday continues the themes of Ordinary Time, focusing on the public ministry of Jesus Christ.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Elizabeth of Hungary, Religious
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Elizabeth of Hungary, a princess known for her charity, devotion to the poor, and her patronage of the Third Order of Saint Francis.

day_title: Optional Memorial of The Dedication of the Basilicas of Saints Peter and Paul, Apostles, or Saint Rose Philippine Duchesne, Virgin (USA)
day_description: This optional memorial commemorates the dedication of the Roman basilicas of Saints Peter and Paul. In the USA, it may also be an optional memorial for Saint Rose Philippine Duchesne, a French nun who established the Society of the Sacred Heart in America.

day_title: Wednesday of Week 33 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Thursday of Week 33 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Memorial of The Presentation of the Blessed Virgin Mary
day_description: This memorial commemorates the presentation of the Blessed Virgin Mary as a child in the Temple, an event not found in canonical scripture but deeply rooted in tradition.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Cecilia, Virgin and Martyr
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Cecilia, an early Christian virgin and martyr, revered as the patroness of musicians.

day_title: Solemnity of Our Lord Jesus Christ, King of the Universe (Christ the King)
day_description: This Solemnity concludes the liturgical year, celebrating Christ's universal reign as King of all creation and reminding the faithful of the ultimate triumph of God's Kingdom.

day_title: Monday of Week 34 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Catherine of Alexandria, Virgin and Martyr
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Catherine of Alexandria, a virgin and martyr of the 4th century, a popular saint in the Middle Ages and patroness of scholars.

day_title: Wednesday of Week 34 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Thursday of Week 34 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Friday of Week 34 in Ordinary Time
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, reflecting on the ongoing ministry and teachings of Christ.

day_title: Saturday of Week 34 in Ordinary Time (Optional Memorial of the Blessed Virgin Mary)
day_description: A weekday in Ordinary Time, which may also include an optional memorial in honor of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

day_title: First Sunday of Advent
day_description: This Sunday marks the beginning of Advent, a season of prayerful waiting and preparation for the celebration of the Nativity of Jesus at Christmas and for his Second Coming.

day_title: Monday of the 1st Week of Advent
day_description: A weekday in Advent, focusing on the themes of expectation and hope for the coming of Christ.

day_title: Tuesday of the 1st Week of Advent
day_description: A weekday in Advent, focusing on the themes of expectation and hope for the coming of Christ.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Francis Xavier, Priest
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Francis Xavier, a co-founder of the Society of Jesus and a pioneering missionary in Asia, known as the 'Apostle of the Indies'.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint John Damascene, Priest and Doctor of the Church
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint John Damascene, an 8th-century priest and Doctor of the Church, known for his theological writings and defense of sacred images.

day_title: Friday of the 1st Week of Advent
day_description: A weekday in Advent, focusing on the themes of expectation and hope for the coming of Christ.

day_title: Optional Memorial of Saint Nicholas, Bishop
day_description: This optional memorial honors Saint Nicholas, a 4th-century bishop of Myra, revered for his generosity and miracles, a source of the Santa Claus tradition.

day_title: Second Sunday of Advent
day_description: This Sunday in Advent continues the themes of preparation, often focusing on the role of John the Baptist as the precursor to Jesus.

day_title: Solemnity of The Immaculate Conception of the Blessed Virgin Mary (Holy Day of Obligation)
day_description: This Solemnity celebrates the belief that the Blessed Virgin Mary was conceived without the stain of original sin, in preparation for her role as the Mother of God. It is the Patronal Feastday of the United States of America.

day_title: Tuesday of the 2nd Week of Advent
day_description: A weekday in Advent, focusing on the themes of expectation and hope for the coming of Christ.

day_title: Wednesday of the 2nd Week of Advent
day_description: A weekday in Advent, focusing on the themes of expectation and hope for the coming of Christ.

day_title: Thursday of the 2nd Week of Advent
day_description: A weekday in Advent, focusing on the themes of expectation and hope for the coming of Christ.

day_title: Feast of Our Lady of Guadalupe (USA)
day_description: This feast commemorates the apparitions of the Blessed Virgin Mary to Saint Juan Diego in Mexico in 1531, a significant event in the evangelization of the Americas.

day_title: Memorial of Saint Lucy, Virgin and Martyr
day_description: This memorial commemorates Saint Lucy, an early Christian virgin and martyr from Syracuse, revered for her steadfast faith.

day_title: Third Sunday of Advent (Gaudete Sunday)
day_description: This Sunday, known as Gaudete Sunday, marks a joyful pause in Advent, symbolized by rose vestments, anticipating the nearing celebration of Christmas.

day_title: Monday of the 3rd Week of Advent
day_description: A weekday in Advent, focusing on the themes of expectation and hope for the coming of Christ.

day_title: Tuesday of the 3rd Week of Advent
day_description: A weekday in Advent, focusing on the themes of expectation and hope for the coming of Christ.

day_title: Wednesday of the 3rd Week of Advent (beginning of the O Antiphons)
day_description: This day marks the beginning of the 'O Antiphons,' a series of majestic prayers sung or recited before the Magnificat at Vespers, anticipating the arrival of Christ.

day_title: Thursday of the 3rd Week of Advent
day_description: A weekday in Advent, continuing the focus on the approaching Nativity of the Lord.

day_title: Friday of the 3rd Week of Advent
day_description: A weekday in Advent, continuing the focus on the approaching Nativity of the Lord.

day_title: Saturday of the 3rd Week of Advent
day_description: A weekday in Advent, continuing the focus on the approaching Nativity of the Lord.

day_title: Fourth Sunday of Advent
day_description: This Sunday is the final Sunday of Advent, with readings intensely focused on the events immediately preceding the birth of Jesus and the anticipation of his coming.

day_title: Monday of the 4th Week of Advent
day_description: A weekday in Advent, with a strong focus on the imminent arrival of Christmas.

day_title: Tuesday of the 4th Week of Advent
day_description: A weekday in Advent, with a strong focus on the imminent arrival of Christmas.

day_title: Christmas Eve (Vigil of the Nativity of the Lord)
day_description: Christmas Eve is the vigil of the Solemnity of the Nativity of the Lord, a day of final preparations and anticipation for the birth of Jesus Christ, often including a vigil Mass.

day_title: Solemnity of The Nativity of the Lord (Christmas Day - Holy Day of Obligation)
day_description: Christmas Day is the joyous Solemnity celebrating the birth of Jesus Christ, the Son of God, and the central mystery of the Incarnation.

day_title: Feast of Saint Stephen, the First Martyr
day_description: This feast commemorates Saint Stephen, the first Christian martyr, who was stoned to death shortly after Pentecost.

day_title: Feast of Saint John, Apostle and Evangelist
day_description: This feast commemorates Saint John the Apostle and Evangelist, one of the twelve apostles, the 'beloved disciple,' and traditionally attributed with writing the Gospel of John, three Epistles, and the Book of Revelation.

day_title: Feast of The Holy Innocents, Martyrs
day_description: This feast commemorates the Holy Innocents, the infant boys of Bethlehem slaughtered by King Herod in his attempt to kill the newborn Jesus.

day_title: Fifth Day in the Octave of Christmas (Optional Memorial of Saint Thomas Becket, Bishop and Martyr)
day_description: A day within the Octave of Christmas, continuing the celebration of the Nativity of the Lord. It may also include an optional memorial for Saint Thomas Becket, an English archbishop martyred for his defense of the Church's rights.

day_title: Sixth Day in the Octave of Christmas
day_description: A day within the Octave of Christmas, continuing the celebration of the Nativity of the Lord.

day_title: Seventh Day in the Octave of Christmas (Optional Memorial of Saint Sylvester I, Pope)
day_description: The final day within the Octave of Christmas, leading up to the Solemnity of Mary, Mother of God. It may also include an optional memorial for Saint Sylvester I, a Pope during the time of Emperor Constantine.
